item.title: Clustering Multipath Components in Radio Channel Modelling
item.description:
The project is maintained by PanLab at University of Victoria, Canada, supervised by Prof.Jianping Pan and Prof.Ruonan Zhang. The research mainly on clustering multipath components in radio channel by applying methods from machine learning.

I had a 3-months research internship in Panlab, where I focus my work on how to improve the clustering performance of multipath components(MPCs) in radio channel. My first work is a modification to an existing clusering methods called Fuzzy C-means algorithm to enable it to fit in clustering MPCs situation. In this work, I introduced a mapping function to make FCM compatible with MPCs situation.

Based on the modified FCM, I proposed a fusion technique to combine multiple snapshots to obtain a low-noise output. The framework and comparison results are in the talk slides. I gained a lot through this internship and further build up my interests in research work.

item.title: A Queuing Network Model For Airport Security Chenck Point
Long-range WIFI communication for solar-powered Unmanned air vehicle
item.description:
The project is maintained by wireless communication Lab at Northwestern Polytechnical University, supervised by Prof.Ruonan Zhang and Prof.Bin Li. The project focuses on improving the communication distane between a Base Station (BS) on the ground and a Mobile Station(MS) on a Unmanned Aircraft Vehicle (UAV).

I joined this team in 2016.3. My job is to Conducted field experiment, Established and monitored the communication systems. The figure below shows the system we paid attention to. The Internet provider links to UAV, who provides Internet access to the ground users whom it covers.

The improvement strategies are mainly for two parts. First is the communicaion protocals and the second is the antenna and tx powers. The team are now developing communication system based on Openwrt. I’ve done some prepare research on Openwrt and work out a tutorial to help people get quick access to Openwrt developing.

The tutorial now is only in Chinese, later will release English version. Click Chapter 1 and Chapter2 to download.

item.title: A System Dynastic Model For Water Resources Analysis
Intelligent Information Processing
item.description:
The project is maintained by Intelligent Information Lab at Northwestern Polytechnical University, supervised by Prof.Yong Deng and Prof.Wen Jiang. The research mainly on fields of Evidence theory, Complexity Network, Fuzzy Set Theory, Bio-inspired AI, etc.

I joined this team in 2015.9. At first my research interests focus on processing multiple evaluations from experts and solve the confliction among opinions. Here is a published paper in Soft Computing. This paper proposed a method that allows experts give ambiguous evaluation and by combining different experts’ opinons up, a defuzziation output can be achieved.

Later on I turned my interests towards Quantum Probability. The quantum probability attracts me in the field of analyzing the human behaviours in Prisoners Dillemma Game. Here is another paper demonstrating that a blief entropy based quantum Bayesian network explains the violation of Sure Things Principle in Prisoners Dillemma Game.

Also, I wrote a simple but robust D-S comination algorithm in Python. Click here to view it.
